marketNews.title: U.S. House Passes Tax and Spending Bill for Trump Cabinet, Dollar Weakens
marketNews.content: The U.S. House of Representatives, controlled by the Republican Party on Thursday (May 22), passed the tax and spending bill for President Donald Trump's cabinet. The bill will fulfill many of Trump's populist campaign promises, such as tax cuts for individuals and corporations, increased military spending, border law enforcement, and ending clean-energy incentives from the Biden era. After being approved by the House, the tax and spending bill will be sent to the U.S. Senate – also controlled by the Republican Party – for final enactment. The bill is expected to add about $3.8 trillion to U.S. government debt over the next decade, raising investor concerns about U.S. solvency. Last week, Moody's downgraded the United States' sovereign credit rating from Aaa with a negative outlook to Aa1 with a stable outlook, marking the first Moody's downgrade of the U.S. since 1917. Prior to Moody's, Fitch and Standard & Poor's also downgraded U.S. debt in 2023 and 2021 respectively. Currently, U.S. government debt stands at 36.2 trillion rupiah. Interest payments on U.S. debt accounted for 12.5% of total U.S. expenditures in 2024 and are projected to rise to 16.7% within the next ten years. Concerns about U.S. debt again pressured the U.S. Dollar Index (DXY), which fell 0.6% to 99.36 in today’s trade on Friday (May 23). Since the start of the year, the DXY has weakened 8.4% year-to-date. Meanwhile, the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield remained flat at 4.528% today. Domestically, the Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.67% to 16,217 per USD and the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rose 0.66% to 7,214.16, supported by a foreign inflow of 589 billion rupiah today. The 10-year Indonesian government bond yield fell 2 basis points to 6.828%. Key Takeaway: The weakening trend of the U.S. dollar is projected to push the rupiah stronger, potentially below 16,000 by Q4 2025, which could be followed by continued foreign inflows into the IHSG. An IHSG rise driven by foreign inflows is expected to benefit the Big 4 banks – BBCA, BMRI, BBNI, BBRI. A stronger rupiah will also positively affect issuers with large import or U.S. dollar-denominated debt exposure, such as ICBP, KLBF, and MAPI.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Bloomberg reported that OPEC+ members are considering a production increase of 411,000 barrels per day in July 2025, three times the originally planned increase, with a final decision to be taken at the June 1, 2025 meeting. However, no final agreement on the exact increase has been reached. Reuters reported that since April 2025, OPEC+ has planned to raise production by a total of 960,000 barrels per day, equivalent to 44% of the 2.2 million barrel per day production cut.
2. Indonesia's Finance Minister Sri Mulyani, on Friday (May 23), appointed several senior officials of the Ministry of Finance, including Lieutenant General (Ret.) Djaka Budi Utama as Director General of Customs and Bimo Wijayanto as Director General of Tax. Kontan previously reported that the appointments were a direct choice by President Prabowo Subianto. Djaka currently serves as the chief secretary of the State Intelligence Agency, while Bimo is an independent commissioner at Phapros (PEHA).
3. The European Union classified Indonesia as a 'standard risk' country under its anti-deforestation law, meaning Indonesian exporters will avoid the strictest compliance checks for goods shipped to Europe. The EU law will still require due-diligence for exports such as soy, beef, palm oil, timber, cocoa, coffee, and chocolate.
4. Bank Indonesia reported that broad money (M2) growth slowed to 5.2% year-over-year in April 2025, down from 6.1% in March 2025, reaching 9,390 trillion rupiah.
5. Shell Indonesia announced on Friday (May 23) that it has reached an agreement to transfer its fuel station business in Indonesia to a joint venture owned by Citadel Pacific Ltd. and Sefas Group. The transaction is expected to be completed in 2026 and does not include Shell Indonesia's lubricants business.
6. Soho Global Health (SOHO) together with its subsidiary PT Soho Industri Pharmasi sold its entire 3.27% stake in PT AstraZeneca Indonesia for 1.84 million USD.
7. Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima (INET) announced that Setyanto Hantoro submitted his resignation as the company's principal commissioner on April 11, 2025, to join BPI Danantara as Managing Director. The resignation will be discussed at the shareholders' meeting on June 12, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BRMS Secures Rp2 Trillion Credit for Refinancing and Mining Construction
tickerNews.content: $BRMS: Bumi Resources Minerals signed a credit facility of 2 trillion rupiah from a consortium led by Bank Mega ($MEGA). The facility has a 12-month tenor with an annual interest rate of 9.75%. The facility will be used to repay an existing loan of 75 million USD (approximately 1.2 trillion rupiah), to finance development of underground gold mining construction in Palu, and exploration activities in Gorontalo.

tickerNews.title: UNTR Reports Strong Komatsu Heavy Equipment Sales in April 2025
tickerNews.content: $UNTR: United Tractors recorded sales of 501 Komatsu heavy equipment units in April 2025, up 21% month-over-month and 83% year-over-year. Cumulatively for the first four months of 2025, Komatsu sales reached 1,886 units, a 34.7% YoY increase, representing 41% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units, with market share falling to 26% (vs. 24% in 3M25 and 29% in 4M24). In the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 42.8 million tons, down 2.9% YoY during 4M25, with overburden removal of 339.1 million cubic meters, down 11.6% YoY.

tickerNews.title: AMRT Plans Capex of Rp4.5-5 Trillion for 2025 Expansion
tickerNews.content: $AMRT: Corporate Secretary of Sumber Alfaria Trijaya, Tomin Widian, stated that the company allocates capex of around 4.5-5 trillion rupiah (versus 2024 realization of 5 trillion rupiah) during 2025 to support a revenue growth target of +7% YoY. The funds are intended for expansion of 1,000 new stores, renewal of permits for 2,700-2,800 stores, and construction of distribution centers in Palangkaraya and Bengkulu.

tickerNews.title: TSPC Announces 2024 Dividend Plan
tickerNews.content: $TSPC: Shareholders of Tempo Scan Pacific approved a dividend plan for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 564 billion rupiah, equivalent to about 39% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~48%). This corresponds to a final dividend of 100 rupiah per share and a final dividend yield of 3.7% as of Friday 23 May. Cum date and payment date have not been announced. Previously, TSPC distributed an interim dividend of 25 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Announces 2024 Dividend of 649 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: $SMGR: Shareholders of Semen Indonesia approved a dividend plan for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 649 billion rupiah, or 96 rupiah per share. This equals about 90% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~26%) and indicates a dividend yield of 3.5% as of Friday 23 May. Cum date and payment date have not been announced.

tickerNews.title: MTDL Declares 2024 Dividend of 295 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: $MTDL: Shareholders of Metrodata Electronics approved a dividend plan for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 295 billion rupiah, or 24 rupiah per share. This corresponds to about 40% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~40%) and indicates a dividend yield of 4.1% as of Friday 23 May. Cum date and payment date have not been announced.

tickerNews.title: GIAA Considers Capital Injection for Garuda Indonesia
tickerNews.content: $GIAA: CEO of BPI Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, said on Thursday (May 22) that the company is still studying a plan to inject capital into Garuda Indonesia. Previously, Bloomberg reported in mid-May 2025 that $GIAA was negotiating with BPI Danantara regarding a capital injection to improve the airline’s finances.

tickerNews.title: TGUK Shareholders Approve Sale of Controlling Stake to Visionary Capital
tickerNews.content: $TGUK: Platinum Wahab Nusantara announced that Singapore-based holding Visionary Capital Global Pte. Ltd. intends to purchase 69.34% of the company’s shares held by the controlling shareholder, PT Dinasti Kreatif Indonesia. Deal value and closing timeline are under negotiation. After the transaction, Visionary Capital Global Pte. Ltd. will become the new controlling shareholder of TGUK and will carry out a mandatory tender offer.
